skill.name: pydeseq2
skill.description: Differential gene expression analysis (Python DESeq2). Identify DE genes from bulk RNA-seq counts, Wald tests, FDR correction, volcano/MA plots, for RNA-seq analysis.
skill.summary: Differential gene expression analysis (Python DESeq2). Identify DE genes from bulk RNA-seq counts, W...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No credential access, environment harvesting, or network exfiltration patterns were found. The code focuses on local data processing and result export.

content.user_title: Analyze bulk RNA-seq counts with PyDESeq2
content.value_statement: You need reliable differential expression results from count matrices. This skill runs a full PyDESeq2 workflow and produces tested outputs and plots.
actual_capabilities: Load count and metadata CSV files and validate sample alignment
Filter low-count genes and missing condition samples
Run PyDESeq2 fitting and Wald tests with FDR correction
Export full results and significant genes to CSV
Save pickled AnnData outputs for reuse
Generate volcano and MA plots when matplotlib is available
limitations: Requires PyDESeq2 and pandas installed in the environment
Expects bulk RNA-seq count matrices, not raw FASTQ data
Does not perform alignment, quantification, or gene annotation

use_cases.title: Run standard DE analysis
use_cases.description: Compare treated versus control samples with FDR correction and export significant genes.

use_cases.title: Control batch effects
use_cases.description: Use a multi-factor design to adjust for batch and test a condition effect.

use_cases.title: Create visualization outputs
use_cases.description: Generate volcano and MA plots for reporting and exploration.

prompt_templates.title: Basic comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Run PyDESeq2 on counts.csv and metadata.csv with design ~condition and contrast condition treated control. Export results to results/.

prompt_templates.title: Batch adjusted
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze counts and metadata using design ~batch + condition with contrast condition treated control. Save outputs to results/.

prompt_templates.title: Custom filtering
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the script with min-counts 20 and alpha 0.01. Use design ~condition and output to results/.

prompt_templates.title: Plots and reuse
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute the CLI with --plots and save outputs to results/. Include LFC shrinkage and keep the pickled dataset.

output_examples.input: Run a treated versus control analysis and report significant genes.
output: Volcano and MA plots saved in results/

best_practices: Ensure counts are non-negative integers and samples match metadata
Filter low-count genes before model fitting to improve power
Use LFC shrinkage only for visualization or ranking
anti_patterns: Using raw p-values for significance instead of adjusted p-values
Skipping metadata alignment checks before analysis
Applying shrinkage and reporting those values as statistical evidence

faq.question: What data formats are supported?
faq.answer: CSV count matrices and CSV metadata tables are supported by the script.

faq.question: Are there limits on dataset size?
faq.answer: Large datasets may require more memory or fewer CPUs for stability.

faq.question: Can this integrate into pipelines?
faq.answer: Yes, the script can be run from workflows and saves standard CSV outputs.

faq.question: Does the skill access sensitive data?
faq.answer: No, it only reads the files you pass and writes local results.

faq.question: What if the script fails to import PyDESeq2?
faq.answer: Install pydeseq2 in the environment, then rerun the command.

faq.question: How does this compare to R DESeq2?
faq.answer: It mirrors DESeq2 defaults in Python while keeping a similar workflow.
